definition: to rub/to grind/to polish/to sharpen/to wear down/to die out/to waste time/to pester/to insist
generic name for hemp, flax etc/hemp or flax fiber for textile materials/sesame/CL:縷|缕[lu:3]/(of materials) rough or coarse/pocked/pitted/to have pins and needles or tingling/to feel numb
dry measure for grain equal to ten dou 斗/ten pecks/one hundred liters

to ponder/to mull over/to think through/Taiwan pr. [zhuo2 mo2]
to carve and polish (jade)/to polish and refine a literary work
to sharpen on grindstone/to improve oneself by practice
to wear down/to sap/to whittle away/to while away/to idle away

sentences.english: The plan is for trains to make their first stop outside China in the border town of Boten in northern Laos.
sentences.chinese: 该计划在中国边境外的第一站是老挝北部城镇磨憨。

sentences.english: The resection of occipital condylar and jugular tuber can increase surgical freedom.
sentences.chinese: 枕髁和颈静脉结节的磨除可增加手术视野。

sentences.english: He was very busy, putting an edge on a scythe .
sentences.chinese: 他正忙着干活，在磨一把长柄大镰刀的刃儿。

sentences.english: The second baseman sharpened his spikes before every game.
sentences.chinese: 那个二垒守垒员每场比赛前都要磨尖他的鞋钉。

sentences.english: The stone was pecked and ground into square flags.
sentences.chinese: 石头被凿开并磨成方石板。

sentences.english: As a resul t, nacre thickness is sometimes just a cosmetic layer t hat can wear thin over time.
sentences.chinese: 所以真珠质的厚度就像脸上化妆品，不久就会磨薄了。

sentences.english: All Japanese pork chop specialist will have you ground your own sesame to make the sauce.
sentences.chinese: 所有日色猪扒店都会要你自己磨芝麻做酱料。

sentences.english: We can grind it in Guanabacoa.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以拿到瓜纳巴科亚去磨。

sentences.english: You own your own meat cleaverand sharpen it.
sentences.chinese: 你有自己的切肉刀而且你会磨它。

sentences.english: He had worn through the blanket- wrappings , and his feet were shapeless lumps of raw meat.
sentences.chinese: 脚下裹的毯子都磨穿了，脚也被磨得没一处好肉。

sentences.english: Because the fishes are corroded seriously, the traditional method of milling bridge plug can't be adopted.
sentences.chinese: 因落鱼腐蚀严重，不能采用传统磨铣桥塞的方法。

sentences.english: Well, Sid don't torment a body the way you do.
sentences.chinese: 噢，希德可不像你这样磨人。

sentences.english: The cook is grinding the radishes into slices.
sentences.chinese: 厨师正在把胡萝卜磨成细丝。

sentences.english: Inorganic pigments are finely ground complexes of metals.
sentences.chinese: 有机颜料是磨得很细的金属复合物。

sentences.english: That mill in turn will cut the trees into smaller pieces known as "cants".
sentences.chinese: 该回合磨将削减坎茨“作为”之称的树木成小块。

sentences.english: The constant rubbing wore down the surface of the stone.
sentences.chinese: 由于经常不断的摩擦，石头的表面已经被磨薄。

definition: milling/to grind/to polish by grinding/to abrade/whetstone/pestle
stone roller/roller and millstone/to grind/to crush/to husk
(literary) to fracture (a bone)/(literary) to cut/to hack/variant of 銼|锉[cuo4]
a saw/to cut with a saw
chisel/to bore a hole/to chisel or dig/(literary) (bound form) certain/authentic/irrefutable/also pr. [zuo4]
